text: Yara Shahidi is not your average 17-year-old — she stars in ABC's Black-ish, advocates for girls' rights, and is an academic all-star — but just like any other teen, her bedroom is her sanctuary. “My room is really the center of how I run my personal empire,” she says. “It’s the center of it — kingdom and castle.” But also similar to her peers, her space was lacking sophisticated design direction. “I had a few things taped on the wall and I had a lot of pieces that weren’t very coordinated,” she says. With a little guidance from online interior design service Laurel & Wolf and PBteen, she was able to transform her mismatched corner of the world into a free-spirited space where she can work, learn and grow. “It was a room just to basically go to sleep in and then wake up and do other things in,” she says. “But now, I can live in my room.”
title: Yara Shahidi's Bedroom Makeover: See the 'Black-ish' Star's Stylish Space
